case_vignette:
A 17-year-old male presents with a several year history of a spot on the neck that developed acute onset pain for the past 3 days and warmth. On examination along the left lateral neck is a tender, soft skin colored nodule. Biopsy is performed and reveals stratified squamous epithelium with surrounding lymphoid tissue.  The patient is diagnosed with a benign condition, a branchial cleft cyst.  The patient is referred to an otolaryngologist for surgical excision of the cyst.
